etymologies: Italian, from modern Latin congregatio de propaganda fide ‘congregation for propagation of the faith’ (see propaganda (sense 2)). propaganda (sense 1) dates from the early 20th century

definitions: information, especially of a biased or misleading nature, used to promote or publicize a particular political cause or point of view

examples.text: he was charged with distributing enemy propaganda

shortDefinitions: information used to promote political cause or point of view

definitions: the dissemination of propaganda as a political strategy

examples.text: the party's leaders believed that a long period of education and propaganda would be necessary

shortDefinitions: dissemination of such information as political strategy

definitions: a committee of cardinals of the Roman Catholic Church responsible for foreign missions, founded in 1622 by Pope Gregory XV.
shortDefinitions: committee of cardinals of Roman Catholic Church responsible for foreign missions
